intro: Sida delphiniifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Delphinium leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, pale blue or purple flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adaptable to a variety of environmental conditions. Sida delphiniifolia is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus. It is sometimes considered a weed due to its aggressive growth habit.
